text: Daniel Patrick Moynihan (March 16, 1927 â€“ March 26, 2003) was an American politician and sociologist. He was a member of the Democratic Party. He was first elected to the United States Senate for New York in 1976, and was re- elected three times (in 1982, 1988, and 1994). He declined to run for re- election in 2000. Moynihan was the United States' Ambassador to the United Nations and to India. He was a member of four successive presidential administrations, beginning with the administration of John F. Kennedy, and continuing through that of Gerald Ford. Moyniham died of surgical complications at a Washington, D.C. hospital, aged 76. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1927 births Category:2003 deaths Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:United States Ambassadors to the United Nations Category:United States senators from New York (state) Category:Politicians from Tulsa, Oklahoma Category:Scientists from Tulsa, Oklahoma Category:Scientists from New York City Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Ambassadors of the United States to India
title: Daniel Patrick Moynihan
